issues.summary: [Navigation] Update desktop navigation for logged in users
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

As part of the Dashboard Improvements initiative, we want to update the navigation for logged in active users.

Changes:

Left navbar:

* Dashboard {color:#ffc400}*ALTERED*{color} -> rename to ‚ÄúHome‚Äù¬†
* Add-ons {color:#ff5630}*NEW*{color} -> should open the add-ons drawer
* Pet profile {color:#ff5630}*NEW*{color}
* Get $60 {color:#4c9aff}*MOVED*{color} -> rename to ‚ÄúGift Free Food‚Äù, remove 10+ (should we keep the icon?)
* Settings {color:#4c9aff}*MOVED*{color} (should we keep the icon?)
* Contact us {color:#36b37e}*SAME*{color}

Right navbar:

* Pet switcher {color:#ffc400}*ALTERED*{color} -> remove ‚ÄúAdd a new pup‚Äù from dropdown
* -Add a new pup- {color:#4c9aff}*-MOVED-*{color} --> visible without clicking on the pet switcher, enabled only for users who are eligible to more dogs, disabled for users who have a cancelled subscription- (here just for reference, but it‚Äôs out of scope for this ticket as it‚Äôs done in [[TPT-2584]|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/TPT-2584].
* Pet Parent name {color:#ffc400}*ALTERED*{color} -> remove settings from dropdown, keep ‚ÄúLog out‚Äù

!image-20260119-110954.png|width=630,alt="image-20260119-110954.png"!
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#ffebe6}
*Out of Scope* 

* Adding the {{Add a new pup}} entry-point to the right navbar is out of scope on this ticket as it should be done in a previous ticket.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria* *_(focus on the what, not the how)_*

* WHEN I am a customer with an active subscription
* AND I am logged in and on desktop view
* THEN I should see the navbar containing:
** Left side
***  Home
*** Add-ons
*** Pet Profile
*** Gift Free Food
*** Contact Us
*** Settings
** Right side:
*** My pet‚Äôs name (being clickable and when clicked, I should see my other pets names if I have other subscriptions, and *I should not see* an Add new pup link in the dropdown)
*** + Add new pup 
*** My name (being clickable and when clicked, showing an option to log out)

!
issues.reporter: Andrea Martins Costa L F Nascimento

issues.summary: Youtube feeding instructions
Feeding portions
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
This section is responsible for informing users about their daily portion quantity. It displays the different portions depending on the user‚Äôs plan type.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Create a {{Feeding}}component to render the different recipe types feeding instructions.

*Unique cards* (Fresh/Mix plan 100%)

When {{FeedingGuide.feedings.length === 1}} and the {{FeedingGuide.product.portionPercentage = 100}}, render the cards as the below design (This means the user is not on a mixed plan and not on a portioned plan)

*Fresh*

!image-20251204-104601.png|width=701,height=143,alt="image-20251204-104601.png"!

*Dry* (_design correction: dry plan should read ‚Äú1/2 cup per day‚Äù)_

!image-20251204-104528.png|width=50%,alt="image-20251204-104528.png"!

* Consume the {{FeedingGuide.feedings}} to display the feeding
* Use {{FeedingGuide.feedings[].getUnit()}} to read the portion unit (cup / packet). If necessary, consider creating a contentful translation to format the string (capitalize, plural, etc)
* Use {{FeedingGuide.feedings[].portionShare.toFraction()}} to render the portion as a fraction [[Ref|https://github.com/rawify/Fraction.js]]
* Use {{FeedingGuide.feedings[].portionShare.getMultipleFeedingPerDay(2)}} to render the percentage in the instruction when feeding 2 times per day (2 is hardcoded)
* All copies should be created in contentful

*Multiple cards* (<100% plans, Mix plan)

When {{FeedingGuide.feedings.length > 1}} OR the {{FeedingGuide.product.portionPercentage < 100}}, render the cards as the below design (This means the user is on a mixed plan or on a portioned plan)

*<100% Portion plans*

!image-20251204-105227.png|width=699,height=523,alt="image-20251204-105227.png"!

*Mixed plans*

!image-20251204-105302.png|width=695,height=740,alt="image-20251204-105302.png"!

* Render every item in {{FeedingGuide.feedings}} 
* Use {{FeedingGuide.feedings[].recipeType}} to render the coloured pill, the plan title is available from [usePlansC

issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

The products will be added to staging and live by [~accountid:6070524cef87dd00688778b2] but will be deactivated. Once all the tickets have been completed that this ticket is blocked by we can bulk edit products to enable them on staging/live. Recommend activating on staging first and doing a lill test-run.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Resources*

* Sku list (incl. cadence + prices): [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kvptwKYox5VQdxqFq2Rq451KvCVYfRnhDnoLhCME9_M/edit?gid=1988913418#gid=1988913418|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kvptwKYox5VQdxqFq2Rq451KvCVYfRnhDnoLhCME9_M/edit?gid=1988913418#gid=1988913418|smart-link]

{panel}

*Acceptance Criteria* *_(focus on the what, not the how)_*

* As a user getting a daily kcal range between 
* As a user on a mix or fresh plan trying to‚Ä¶
** update my daily calories I can‚Ä¶
*** change my daily calories to 2250
*** update my cadence when selecting 2250 kcals
**** I see correct prices for my cadence options
* As a user on a dry plan trying to‚Ä¶
** update my daily calories I can‚Ä¶
*** change my daily calories to 2250 and 60
** update my plan I can‚Ä¶
** choose between 4 different plans (dry, mix, fresh 100% & fresh 50%)
*** I see correct plan prices displayed
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}

issues.summary: Quarantine System: reactivation.spec.ts
issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: reactivation.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/63052
695 test runs, 536 test failures, 46 test retries, 23.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/63052 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #squad-nv-pet-food or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: Feeding guide header
Add E2E tests
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Let‚Äôs add some E2E tests to make sure our feeding guide works properly.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
Test cases:

* Navigating from dashboard to the feeding guide
** Assert the meal selection from the dashboard match the feeding instructions in the feeding guide based on the recipe type (FR, DR, MX)
* Landing directly on {{/feeding-guide}} logged in with a valid subscription
** Assert the user is redirected to {{/feeding-guide/{week}}} with the correct next deliverable week
** Assert the meal selection from that week match the feeding instructions in the feeding guide based on the recipe type (FR, DR, MX)
* Landing directly on {{/feeding-guide}} NOT logged in with a valid subscription
** Assert the user is redirected to log-in
** After logging in, assert the user is redirected back to feeding guide
** Assert the meal selection from that week match the feeding instructions in the feeding guide based on the recipe type (FR, DR, MX)
{panel}

issues.summary: Update Feeding Guide CTA to point to the new route
Add monitoring
FeedingGuideRoot component + loading skeleton
Filter out cadence delivery options from edit address page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

When user is editing their delivery address we run validation on their delivery option and if its no longer valid for the new address then we update it to a new delivery option, when we change their delivery option we currently filter the delivery options based on cadence, E.g. if it‚Äôs a plan that should have a 4 week cadence, we filter the options to only return anything with {{*-4WEEKLY}}. As on of the first steps in deprecating the cadence delivery options, we want to filter out all cadence delivery options that have cadence in them (anything with {{WEEKLY}} at the end). This should be behind a feature flag for now.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria* *_(focus on the what, not the how)_*

* If feature flag is on: 
** If user‚Äôs current delivery option is no longer valid, it‚Äôs updated to a valid +*non-cadence*+ delivery option
** If user‚Äôs delivery option is still valid but is a cadence delivery option, it remains unchanged
* If feature flag is off (BAU)
* Should be reflected in both settings - edit address and reactivation - edit address.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*Developer Information* 

* This is a good place to start from [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/EditDeliveryAddress/hooks/multi-pet/useHandleSaveAddress.ts|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/EditDeliveryAddress/hooks/multi-pet/useHandleSaveAddress.ts] 
* Feature gate: [https://console.statsig.com/VNhnT1dlnFGbNlAloFMfp/gates/tpt_deprecate_cadence_delivery_options|https://console.statsig.com/VNhnT1dlnFGbNlAloFMfp/gates/tpt_deprecate_cadence_delivery_options|smart-link] 
* [https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/master/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/libraries/services/delivery-dates-options/utils/filterDeliveryOptions.ts#L13|https:

issues.summary: Revamp the Signup Page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Customer Problem:*

Currently, over 24% customers drop off on the sign up page as customers are not motivated enough or see the benefit of the product to create an account with TPT.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Solution:*

On the top of the sign up page, we will show a banner that will build customer trust with the benefits of the products and increase there intent to sign up and order their first box with TPT.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Success Metric:*

* Increase in registration page conversions
* Gross CVR improvement
* No decline in retention


{panel}

*Requirements (Design WIP):*

When customer reaches the sign up page

# Show CTA: ‚ÄúEnter your email‚Äù
# Show a static banner as in the designs attached

After customer enter email and clicks continue:

# Show CTA: ‚ÄúEnter your password‚Äù (for new customers)
## If customer already has an account with TPT
### Show CTA on top ‚ÄúWelcome back‚Äù with subheading ‚ÄúLogin to your Pets Table account‚Äù
# Persist the banner on the screen where customer has to enter a password.

*Figma*: [https://www.figma.com/design/jNdT9FMbXNpxNukrSCwfQ0/-SBD-2599--Sign-up-page-revamp?node-id=8205-7983&t=mMD4NL4lJwdOZqlA-0|https://www.figma.com/design/jNdT9FMbXNpxNukrSCwfQ0/-SBD-2599--Sign-up-page-revamp?node-id=8205-7983&t=mMD4NL4lJwdOZqlA-0|smart-link] 

!Screenshot 2026-01-15 at 14.07.46.png|width=354,alt="Screenshot 2026-01-15 at 14.07.46.png"!

issues.summary: Enable Passwordless Sign up & Login for TPT
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Customer Problem:*

Customers currently need to add a password on the sign up page, which is not necessary for them to place the first order with TPT.¬†
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Solution:*

Similar to HelloFresh, we will remove the need for customers to add a password on the sign up page by adding a one click ‚ÄúPasswordless‚Äù sign up option. In HelloFresh, reducing friction by adding passwordless ([+statsig+|https://console.statsig.com/VNhnT1dlnFGbNlAloFMfp/experiments/global_acquisition_passwordless_registration/results]) sign ups improved conversion by 0.8%. We will also enable the passwordless login options to allow customers with or without password to login on the customer dashboard easily


{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Success Metric:*

* Increase in registration page conversions
* Gross CVR improvement
* No decline in retention


{panel}

*Requirements (Design WIP):*

*Case 1: When Customer doesn't have an account with us*

[Figma Prototype|https://www.figma.com/proto/jNdT9FMbXNpxNukrSCwfQ0/-SBD-2599--Sign-up-page-revamp?page-id=8075%3A10415&node-id=8075-14565&viewport=-6451%2C-4678%2C0.31&t=nFtJoUK4tdzWONqo-1&scaling=scale-down&content-scaling=fixed&starting-point-node-id=8075%3A16045&show-proto-sidebar=1]

As a customer when I come to the sign up page in the funnel, show me the option to proceed without filling a password.¬†

The customer will see the email field filled up, with two button with the CTA below:

* Continue without password
* Set password

Below are the expected customer experience, when customer clicks on CTAs on this page:

# If the customer clicks on the email address, take them to the page where they can enter email only (this is the current experience)
# If the customer clicks on ‚ÄúContinue without password‚Äù:

* Create a new customer account and¬†
* Navigate¬†them to the address page (Checkout)

# If the customer enters a password & clicks on ‚ÄúContinue‚Äù:¬†
#* Navigate the customer to Address page (checkout)

issues.summary: Trigger a discount notification banner in the reactivation flow
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Description*

Given the limitation on the pricing endpoint for multipet users on reactivation page, we want to offer an alternative way to inform these users about the voucher applied. We aligned to use the discount notification banner and trigger it on both /my-deliveries and /plan-reactivation pages

Context of the problem:

* When these users apply a reactivation voucher, they see a success message, but the price in the price summary on the Reactivation page does not update, as they normally would. This happens because the pricing endpoint views the account as "active," while the voucher is configured strictly for "reactivation."
* The Good News: The discount is correctly applied at checkout; only the preview price on the Reactivation page is incorrect. The user sees the right price in the price summary if they reactivate
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#ffebe6}
*Out of Scope* 

* If applicable, when the task/feature is split into multiple tickets
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria* *_(focus on the what, not the how)_*

*Single-box reactivation voucher*

* WHEN I am a deactivated user
* AND I am on the /plan-reactivation page
* AND I apply a valid single box voucher
* THEN I should see the single box voucher notification on top of the page with the message ‚ÄúYour discount is applied! You're getting [XX] off!‚Äù

!image-20260106-174026.png|width=341,height=258,alt="image-20260106-174026.png"!

*Multi-box reactivation voucher*

* WHEN I am a deactivated user
* AND I am on the /plan-reactivation page
* AND I apply a valid multi-box voucher
* THEN I should see the exact multi-box voucher notification that we show on the funnel 

!image-20260106-174104.png|width=336,height=294,alt="image-20260106-174104.png"!
{panel}

issues.summary: Quarantine System: allergens.spec.ts
issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: allergens.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62743
103 test runs, 38 test failures, 95 test retries, 63.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62743 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #squad-nv-pet-food or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: Funnel Navigation improvements: Back button from the Recipe Selection page should take customer to Plan Selection page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Expected Outcome*

The expected outcome is ‚Ä¶

When customer click on the ‚Äúback‚Äù button on the recipe (meal) selection page customer should navigate back to the Plan selection page. (Please note: the back button on the browser correctly navigates customer to the plan selection page). See issue in the video attached.

Currently, clicking on the ‚Äúback‚Äù button on the recipe selection page, navigates customers back to the step 1 of the onboarding quiz, which results in customers asked to fill in the essential questions again and wait for the calorie calculation.

Navigating the customer back in the funnel leads to decline in conversion and decline in customer trust with PetsTable digital experience.

*Data required for prioritization:* In what % of sessions, customer click on the ‚Äúback‚Äù button of the recipe selection page. 


{panel}

h3. *Scope (choose one):* {color:#97A0AF}*[ TBD ]*{color}  {color:#FF5630}*[ FIX THE BROKEN ]*{color}  {color:#FF991F}*[ SOLVE UNMET NEEDS ]*{color} {color:#36B37E}*[ ABOVE AND BEYOND NEEDS ]*{color} {color:#00B8D9}*[ INNOVATE ]*{color} 

||*What is the problem we‚Äôre solving for customers?*|Customers currently have to navigate through the questionnaire again if they click on the back button on the recipe selection page. 
As we aim to have a variety of meal plans to offer customers, this will increase the time it takes for customers to make a satisfactory meal plan/recipe choice for their pet.  
Allowing easier navigation from recipe to plan selection page will allow customers to make a decision quickly and move forward in the funnel to address/payment pages.|
||*Why will customers care if we work on this?*|Customers expect the ‚Äúback‚Äù button on recipe selection page to perform the expected action - take them back to plan selection page. Navigating customers back to the step 1 of questionnaire increases effort to complete transaction and reduce customer trust with TPT digital experience.|
||*What company strategy bene
